      • hasKey

        public boolean hasKey(@Nonnull
                      java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Searches for the key in this context only.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search
        Returns:
        true if the context contains the given key, false otherwise

      • remove

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Object remove(@Nonnull
                                         java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Removes a key from this context. Does not affect the context's hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be removed
        Returns:
        the value associated with the key or null if there wasn't any value.

      • removeAs

        @Nullable
public <T> T removeAs(@Nonnull
                                java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Removes a key from this context. Does not affect the context's hierarchy. Blindly casts the returned value.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be removed
        Returns:
        the value associated with the key or null if there wasn't any value.

      • removeConverted

        @Nullable
public <T> T removeConverted(@Nonnull
                                       java.lang.String key,
                                       @Nonnull
                                       java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Removes a key from this context. Does not affect the context's hierarchy. The value is converted to type T if found using a PropertyEditor.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be removed
        type - the type to be returned
        Returns:
        the value associated with the key or null if there wasn't any value.

      • put

        public void put(@Nonnull
                java.lang.String key,
                @Nullable
                java.lang.Object value)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Sets a key/value pair on this context. If the context has a parent and if the key matches a parent key then the value will shadow the parent's, that is, the parent value will not be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be registered
        value - the value to save

      • putAt

        public void putAt(@Nonnull
                  java.lang.String key,
                  @Nullable
                  java.lang.Object value)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Sets a key/value pair on this context. If the context has a parent and if the key matches a parent key then the value will shadow the parent's, that is, the parent value will not be overwritten. Convenience method to use in Groovy aware environments.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be registered
        value - the value to save

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Destroys this context. Once destroyed a context should not be used anymore.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface Context
        Overrides:
        destroy in class AbstractContext

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keySet()

        Returns a Set view of the keys contained in this context.
